titleStmt.title: R. E. Collins et al. to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG4901

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p: The undersigned citizens of Franklin County, being well acquainted with Elisha T. Herndon, now confined in the Kentucky State Penitentiary by conviction of the Grant Circuit Court at the November Term 1859, respectfully unite in the petition for his pardon.

R E Collins
Joseph Parrent
J D Parrent
Winston Vaughan
J. M. C Cready
C Bailey
Alex Wilson
W. T. Reading
J. H. Bailey
F. M. Scofield
John Jenkins
J. W. Jenkins
W. F. Parrent
C. H. Parrent
J. Shumate
Jno. J. Julian
Saint J. Julian
Ira Julian
R. L. Cunningham
James Darlington
H. S. Mayhall
Abel Jenkins
T. B. Johnson

The persons signing the above petition are known to me to be among the best citizens of Franklin County.
Apl 11th 1864
James Harlan Jr

Grant Circuit Ct
vs
E. T. Herndon
Box 158
1326
